name: Cahir House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only booked at Cahir House hotel after cancelling a second night's stay at another hotel because it was such a disappointment, Cahir House Hotel made up for it.
reviews.title: Convenient Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Decent room, good food and drink and service in the bar. The member of the breakfast staff on duty needs a little extra training in how to look after guests but breakfast itself very good.
reviews.title: fantastic value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Close to everything-shops, pubs and restaurants within yards. Just a stroll to the Castle and River - a short walk along the river (or drive for a mile) to the Swiss Cottage - well worth a visit if you are staying in Cahir.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: good honest hotel. good bar, fantastic breakfast, service good, friendly staff. Just what you need
reviews.title: Honest welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: when travelling through Ireland, Big car park and right in the middle of town at a price that will not break the bank.
reviews.title: Good location for visiting the Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff very friendly and hotel located right in the main square. Parking to rear and food in the bar very good. We had a room at the front and it was large with a sleigh bed. Lovely pictures from local photographer about. Breakfast was fine but like my bacon well cooked.
reviews.title: Large room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: I was not arriving until late as in 5.30 A.M. and I had out it in my original email when booking. I called to confirm that day and the lady told me since I was not arriving until late she had extended my checkout time which was 11.00 A.M. normally so as to give me a sleep in. Fair play - comfortable , quiet room and had a good snooze! Well done ...
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent food,especially the roast beef.Great service very quick..very good choice of deserts,and more important very reasonably priced.when we were there on the 8th of July there was a wedding on at the time,but it didn't hinder ,the speed with which we were served.the staff were very friendly even though under pressure with the wedding group.highly recommended,We will be back
reviews.title: Lunch Menu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: i looked on the website and checked out the pictures and menu and got so excited about my stay here, I arrived early so headed to the bar for a coffee, I was given filter coffee in a canteen style tea/coffee cup, so of course after to sips I had to ask for a refill, when paying he didn't charge me for the refill which was nice.
reviews.title: great reception staff but thats it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I then went to check in and the staff were terrific, she seen it was a hot day and changed my room to town view as it would be cooler and she also organised my suitcases to be brought up to the room since all rooms are located up stairs and thy have no lift.
reviews.title: Good "old style" hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a two night stay booked here and had a wonderful trip. We explored the countryside and the woodland walk to the back of the hotel and visited the cattle as well as enjoying the food in the hotel.
reviews.title: A lovely weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The management were so helpful and were always available. We enjoyed a meal in he hotel nod breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: An enjoyable few days spent in a friendly hotel. Particular thanks goes to the helpful woman who cleaned our room. A good value hotel and a great breakfast. If you are looking for faults then no doubt you will find them-the bathroom was a little tired in places but we did not have any issues. There was plenty of hot water and the shower worked surprisingly well. Just a helpful hint, take your own toiletries, as there are only soap dispensers in the bathroom. Our double room was quite large, with a comfortable double and a single bed. The rooms are not very well soundproofed and you may well hear your neighbours television. There was music in the bar but we could not hear it from our room.
reviews.title: Disappointing bar service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I attended a cookery demonstration in this hotel on 22nd March 2013. In excess of 150 people arrived for the demo at 7.30 pm. The demo was excellent and informative. At around 8.45 we all took a 15 minute break for refreshments. As we all descended on the bar, the bar staff dropped from 3 staff then to two and then to one staff member left to serve the regulars and the influx of cooking enthusiasts. A female manager appeared to help at the bar but was less than helpful when we pointed out that we had to return to the demo in the next few minutes. I was lucky to get a glass of red wine and a bottle of still water. Many more did not get served at all.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxed stay, lovely food, good service & great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to the excellent demo that ended after 11.15 pm. Again the same situation at the crowded bar, with no apology or explanation for the poor service. I traveled some distance for the demo and would have liked a quick drink before departure but in the end I reckon i was home by the fire before I would have been served.
reviews.title: An unwashed stay not by choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a lovely overnight stay here on 16th Feb. The Room was adequate, small, floorboards creaky, but fine. We had dinner in the Hotel bistro - it was excellent. The staff were very courteous and professional.
reviews.title: Cahir Hidden treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: There were 2 young people playing easy listening music in the bar on Sat night, which gave a nice atmosphere.
reviews.title: Overall value for what you pay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cahir was surprisingly nice, There are lots of sights - Swiss Cottage, Cahir Castle - two of the places to explore. Galtymore mountain is only 8 miles away and worth a hike.
reviews.title: fabulous meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was excellent value as we had a Living & Social Deal.
reviews.title: SUPERB STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel very centrally located, food was good value and very tasty. Rooms were outdated but very clean it was very noisy at night the walls were very thin and hard not to hear people in the next room or outside the door. Staff were very nice one Barman in particularly was not so friendly but maybe he just had a bad night. Everyone else was lovely.
reviews.title: friends get away

description: Cahir House Hotel is set like a jewel in the heart of hertiage town Cahir. The hotel is very much the focal point of the town and is very popular with tourists and locals alike. For the past two years the property is under new management which has seen its patronage improve. The hotel itself has 42 well appointed rooms, a restaurant/bistro, an elegant bar and a beauty salon. There is a host of local attractions/ammenities.
